body_html: This is a known issue with some pip installations. The workaround is documented here: simply download the .whl file using curl or wget, then pass the name of the downloaded file to pip install in place of the URL.
body_text: This is a known issue with some pip installations. The workaround is documented here: simply download the .whl file using curl or wget, then pass the name of the downloaded file to pip install in place of the URL.
body: This is a known issue with some `pip` installations. The workaround is documented [here](https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.8/get_started/os_setup.html#sslerror_ssl_verify_failed): simply download the `.whl` file using `curl` or `wget`, then pass the name of the downloaded file to `pip install` in place of the URL.
